basics.name: Ayush Moharana
basics.label: Reseacrh Associate
basics.about: Astronomer interested in the study of multiple star systems. Escpecially if it has an eclipsing component.

work.name: Keele University
work.position: Research associate in pulsating binary stars
work.summary: Working with Dr. John Southworth on pulsating binary systems.

work.name: National Institute of Technology, Rourkela
work.summary: Working with Dr. AC Pradhan on UV photometry to constrain the Milky Way structure.

work.name: Manipal Centre for Natural Science, Manipal
work.summary: Working with Dr. D Bhattacharya on constraining blazar jet properties using inverse modelling of SED.

education.summary: Dissertation: Comprehensive study of low-mass Compact Hierarchical Triples using Eclipsing Binaries
Dissertation: Ultraviolet Studies of Galactic Globular Clusters using Observations from Ultraviolet Imaging Telescope

awards.title: NCAC Young researcher of the year
awards.summary: Awarded for the multidimensional research on triple star systems, specifically for the integration of theoretical studies with observations

grants and fellowships.summary: A 3 year grant of 203,096 PLN for the project 'Evolution of tight triple stars'.
1 year fellowship to work on the project 'Constraining Milky Way structure using UV star counts'.
